verses.verse: Now <WG1161> accept <WG4355> the one who is weak <WG770> in faith, <WG4102> [but] not for [the purpose of] passing <WG1253> judgment <WG1253> on his opinions. <WG1261>
One <WG3739> <WG3303> man has <WG4100> faith <WG4100> that he may eat <WG2068> all <WG3956> things, <WG3956> but he who is weak <WG770> eats <WG2068> vegetables <WG3001> [only.]

Let not him who eats <WG2068> regard <WG1848> with contempt <WG1848> him who does not eat, <WG2068> and let not him who does not eat <WG2068> judge <WG2919> him who eats, <WG2068> for God <WG2316> has accepted <WG4355> him.

Who <WG5101> are you to judge <WG2919> the servant <WG3610> of another <WG245>? To his own <WG2398> master <WG2962> he stands <WG4739> or <WG2228> falls; <WG4098> and stand <WG2476> he will, for the Lord <WG2962> is able <WG1414> to make <WG2476> him stand. <WG2476>

One <WG3739> <WG3303> man regards <WG2919> one day <WG2250> above <WG3844> another, <WG2250> another <WG3739> <WG1161> regards <WG2919> every <WG3956> day <WG2250> [alike.] Let each <WG1538> man <WG1538> be fully <WG4135> convinced <WG4135> in his own <WG2398> mind. <WG3563>

He who observes <WG5426> the day, <WG2250> observes <WG5426> it for the Lord, <WG2962> and he who eats, <WG2068> does <WG2068> so <WG2068> for the Lord, <WG2962> for he gives <WG2168> thanks <WG2168> to God; <WG2316> and he who eats <WG2068> not, for the Lord <WG2962> he does not eat, <WG2068> and gives <WG2168> thanks <WG2168> to God. <WG2316>
For not one <WG3762> of us lives <WG2198> for himself, <WG1438> and not one <WG3762> dies <WG599> for himself; <WG1438>

for if <WG1437> we live, <WG2198> we live <WG2198> for the Lord, <WG2962> or <WG5037> if <WG1437> we die, <WG599> we die <WG599> for the Lord; <WG2962> therefore <WG3767> whether <WG1437> <WG5037> we live <WG2198> or <WG1437> <WG5037> die, <WG599> we are the Lord's.
For to this <WG3778> end Christ <WG5547> died <WG599> and lived <WG2198> [again], that He might be Lord <WG2961> both <WG2532> of the dead <WG3498> and of the living. <WG2198>

But you, why <WG5101> do you judge <WG2919> your brother <WG80>? Or <WG2228> you again, <WG2532> why <WG5101> do you regard <WG1848> your brother <WG80> with contempt <WG1848>? For we shall all <WG3956> stand <WG3936> before <WG3936> the judgment <WG968> seat <WG968> of God. <WG2316>

For it is written, <WG1125> "As I live, <WG2198> says <WG3004> the Lord, <WG2962> every <WG3956> knee <WG1119> shall bow <WG2578> to Me, And every <WG3956> tongue <WG1100> shall give <WG1843> praise <WG1843> to God. <WG2316>"
So <WG686> then <WG686> each <WG1538> one <WG1538> of us shall give <WG1325> account <WG3056> of himself <WG1438> to God. <WG2316>

Therefore <WG3767> let us not judge <WG2919> one <WG240> another <WG240> anymore, <WG3371> but rather <WG3123> determine <WG2919> this <WG3778> â€“ not to put <WG5087> an obstacle <WG4348> or <WG2228> a stumbling <WG4625> block <WG4625> in a brother's way.

I know <WG3609> and am convinced <WG3982> in the Lord <WG2962> Jesus <WG2424> that nothing <WG3762> is unclean <WG2839> in itself; <WG1438> but to him who thinks <WG3049> anything <WG5100> to be unclean, <WG2839> to him it is unclean. <WG2839>

For if <WG1487> because <WG1223> of food <WG1033> your brother <WG80> is hurt, <WG3076> you are no <WG3765> longer <WG3765> walking <WG4043> according <WG2596> to love. <WG26> Do not destroy <WG622> with your food <WG1033> him for whom <WG3739> Christ <WG5547> died. <WG599>
Therefore <WG3767> do not let what <WG18> is for you a good <WG18> thing <WG18> be spoken <WG987> of as evil; <WG987>
for the kingdom <WG932> of God <WG2316> is not eating <WG1035> and drinking, <WG4213> but righteousness <WG1343> and peace <WG1515> and joy <WG5479> in the Holy <WG40> Spirit. <WG4151>
For he who in this <WG3778> [way] serves <WG1398> Christ <WG5547> is acceptable <WG2101> to God <WG2316> and approved <WG1384> by men. <WG444>
So <WG686> then <WG686> let us pursue <WG1377> the things which make for peace <WG1515> and the building <WG3619> up of one <WG240> another. <WG240>

Do not tear <WG2647> down <WG2647> the work <WG2041> of God <WG2316> for the sake <WG1752> of food. <WG1033> All <WG3956> things <WG3956> indeed <WG3303> are clean, <WG2513> but they are evil <WG2556> for the man <WG444> who eats <WG2068> and gives <WG1223> offense. <WG4348>
It is good <WG2570> not to eat <WG2068> meat <WG2907> or <WG3366> to drink <WG4095> wine, <WG3631> or <WG3366> [to do anything] by which <WG3739> your brother <WG80> stumbles. <WG4350>

The faith <WG4102> which <WG3739> you have, <WG2192> have <WG2192> as your own <WG4572> conviction <WG4572> before <WG1799> God. <WG2316> Happy <WG3107> is he who does not condemn <WG2919> himself <WG1438> in what <WG3739> he approves. <WG1381>

But he who doubts <WG1252> is condemned <WG2632> if <WG1437> he eats, <WG2068> because <WG3754> [his eating is] not from faith; <WG4102> and whatever <WG3956> <WG3739> is not from faith <WG4102> is sin. <WG266>
